info.text: Sorry, you have to wait a bit longer before exiting. It seems as if we have missed information to display to you, and Juan and I don't want a bad grade.
The respiratory system is vital to the circulatory system. The respiratory brings in oxygen, which the body needs for cellular respiration, and
oxygenates the blood. The circulatory system then spreads this oxygenated blood all around the body, keeping us alive.
(Can you guess which system we're going to?)
